docs.snippet: I’ll miss the House of Representatives, but I won’t miss begging for money....
docs.lead_paragraph: I’ll miss the House of Representatives, but I won’t miss begging for money.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Rep Steve Israel of New York warns fund-raising regime from which he has been liberated, as he is not seeking re-election, is dangerous to country's democracy; details how much time he spent as congressman trying to fund-raise, rather than legislate for his constituents, and calls for campaign finance reform.

headline.main: Steve Israel: Confessions of a Congressman

docs.snippet: In a FIFA presidential election where all candidates are presenting themselves as reformers, Asian soccer boss Sheikh Salman Bin Ebrahim Al Khalifa is making his pitch as the safest option to officials beleaguered by the organization's crisis....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a FIFA presidential election where all candidates are presenting themselves as reformers, Asian soccer boss Sheikh Salman Bin Ebrahim Al Khalifa is making his pitch as the safest option to officials beleaguered by the organization's crisis.

headline.main: Sheikh Salman Positions as Safe Pair of Hands in FIFA Vote
headline.print_headline: Sheikh Salman Positions as Safe Pair of Hands in FIFA Vote

docs.snippet: Although some of the most reviled Mubarak-era figures were barred from the election, several other officials or close relatives have seen their political fortunes restored....
docs.lead_paragraph: Although some of the most reviled Mubarak-era figures were barred from the election, several other officials or close relatives have seen their political fortunes restored.
docs.abstract: Egyptian Parliament is set to be seated for first time in three years, and many of country's  lawmakers either served during Pres Hosni Mubarak's reign or are relatives of those who flourished under Mubarak; critics say return of many of same faces is indication that Parliament is merely window dressing for Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi's autocratic rule.

headline.main: Egypt’s Parliament Prepares for Session With Some Familiar Names
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Parliament May Be Missing Prominent Faces, but the Names Are Familiar
